title: Quarto Basics
text:
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2 * np.pi * r
fig, ax = plt.subplots(
  subplot_kw = {'projection': 'polar'} 
)
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()




FigureÂ 1: A line plot on a polar axis

class Point():
    def __init__(self, x, y):
        self.x = x
        self.y = y
    
    def __repr__(self):
        return "Point(x=%r, y=%r)" % (self.x, self.y)
    
    def __str__(self):
        return f'Just a normal 2d point({self.x}, {self.y})'


p = Point(3, 4)


p

Point(x=3, y=4)



repr(p)

'Point(x=3, y=4)'



print(p)

Just a normal 2d point(3, 4)



str(p)

'Just a normal 2d point(3, 4)'
